description:
What makes a good API for a library? Or more importantly, what makes an
API bad?

Implementing an API is an art. It’s the connection between the user and
the library itself. How can we optimize that connection to make the
experience more pleasing? What makes a user reach for one library over
another? What goes into an ergonomic API?

This talk will discuss what makes an API good: simplicity, consistency,
and flexibility. We will apply those principles by iterating and
improving on a real world example, ending with a library that is
delightful to work with.
title: The Design of Everyday APIs
